sen.j: 聖林寺（しょうりんじ）は奈良県桜井市にある真言宗室生寺派の寺院である。
sen.e: Shorin-ji is a Shingon sect Murou-ji temple in Sakurai City, Nara Prefecture.
Shorin-ji Temple is a temple of the Muro-ji school of Shingon sect located in Sakurai City, Nara Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 文法ミス、ローマ字表記ミス及び訳抜けがあったので、直しました。
sen.e: Shorin-ji Temple is a temple of the Muro-ji school of Shingon sect located in Sakurai City, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 山号は霊園山（りょうおんざん）、本尊は地蔵菩薩、開基（創立者）は定恵（じょうえ）とされる。
sen.e: Sango (title given to Buddhist temple) is Ryoon-zan, honzon (principle image of Buddha) is Jizo Bosatsu, and the founder is known as Joe.
Its sango (literally, "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to a Buddhist temple, is Ryoon-zan, its honzon (the principle image of Buddha) is Jizo Bosatsu, and the founder is known as Joe.
sen.cmt: 用語統一シートの定訳を使用しました。
sen.e: Its sango (literally, "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to a Buddhist temple, is Ryoon-zan, its honzon (the principle image of Buddha) is Jizo Bosatsu, and the founder is known as Joe.

sen.j: 国宝の十一面観音立像を所蔵することで知られる。
sen.e: It is known to store the national treasure, standing statue of Eleven-faced Kannon (Goddess of Mercy).
It is known to store a national treasure, the standing statue of eleven-faced Kannon (Goddess of Mercy).
It is known to store a national treasure, the standing statue of eleven-faced Kannon (Goddess of Mercy).

sen.j: 聖林寺は桜井市街地の南方、北方に奈良盆地を見下ろす小高い位置にある。
sen.e: Shorin-ji Temple is located in the high area in the southern Sakurai City looking over the Nara basin to the northern direction.
Shorin-ji Temple is located in the slightly higher area in the south part of Sakurai City where the Nara basin can be looked over to the north.
sen.cmt: 正確に訳されていない部分があったので、修正を加えました。
sen.e: Shorin-ji Temple is located in the slightly higher area in the south part of Sakurai City which commands a view of the Nara basin to the north and the south.
sen.cmt: where the Nara basin can be looked over to the north→which commands a view of the Nara basin to the north「南方」の訳漏れに対応しました。

sen.j: 伝承では和銅5年（712年）に妙楽寺(現在の談山神社)の別院として藤原鎌足の長子・定慧（じょうえ）が創建したという。
sen.e: The tradition tells that Joe, the first son of FUJIWARA no Kamatari founded this temple as the branch temple of Myoraku-ji Temple (present Tanzan-jinja Shrine) in 712.
Tradition says that Joe, the first son of FUJIWARA no Kamatari, founded this temple as a branch temple of Myoraku-ji Temple (present Tanzan-jinja Shrine) in 712.
sen.cmt: Tellは文法的に不可だと思うので、sayを使って言い換えました。comma抜けがあり、補いました。
sen.e: Tradition says that Joe, the first son of FUJIWARA no Kamatari, founded this temple as a branch temple of Myoraku-ji Temple (present Tanzan-jinja Shrine) in 712.

sen.j: 妙楽寺の後身である談山神社は当寺のはるか南方の山中に位置する。
sen.e: A later self of Myoraku-ji Temple is located in the mountains far south of this temple.
Tanzan-jinja Shrine, which is the successor of Myoraku-ji Temple, is located in the mountains to the far south of this temple.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れ「談山神社は」があり、訳を補いました。単語を少し変更しました。
sen.e: Tanzan-jinja Shrine, which is the successor of Myoraku-ji Temple, is located in the mountains to the far south of this temple.

sen.j: 聖林寺の近世までの歴史は不明の部分が多いが、妙楽寺とともに、大神神社（おおみわじんじゃ）とも関連が深い寺院であったと思われる。
sen.e: Many parts of the history of Shorin-ji Temple up until the modern times remains unclear, but it is said that it had close relations with Oomiwa-jinja Shirine along with Myoraku-ji Temple.
A great part of the history of Shorin-ji Temple up until the modern times remains unclear, but it is thought that it had close relations with Omiwa-jinja Shirine along with Myoraku-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: 文法ミス（s/v agreement）、及びローマ字表記ミス（Oomiwaをomiwaとした）があったので直しました。
sen.e: A great part of the history of Shorin-ji Temple up until the modern times remains unclear, but it is thought that it had close relations with Omiwa-jinja Shirine along with Myoraku-ji Temple.

sen.j: 江戸時代には性亮玄心（しょうりょうげんしん）が三輪山の遍照院を移して再興したという。
sen.e: In the Edo period, Shoryo Genshin transferred the Henjo-in Temple of Mt. Miwa for restoration.
It is said that Shoryo Genshin transferred the Henjo-in Temple of Mt. Miwa to this place and restored it in the Edo period.
sen.cmt: 原文が情報不足だと思います。文脈上意味が通る文となるよう、「この地に（移して～）」を補いました。
sen.e: It is said that Shoryo Genshin transferred the Henjo-in Temple of Mt. Miwa to this place and restored it in the Edo period.

sen.j: 江戸中期には現在の本尊・子安延命地蔵菩薩像が造像され，安産・子授けの祈祷寺としても栄える。
sen.e: In the middle of Edo period, the current honzon, statue of Koan Enmei Jizo Bosatsu was made and it flourished as a prayer temple for the safe delivery of the babies, and also to be blessed with children.
In the middle of Edo period, the current honzon, the statue of Koyasu Enmei Jizo Bosatsu, was made and the temple flourished as a prayer temple for the impregnation and safe delivery of a baby.
sen.cmt: 「子安」は「koyasu」と読むのだと思われます。
sen.e: In the middle of Edo period, the current honzon, the statue of Koyasu Enmei Jizo Bosatsu, was made and the temple flourished as a prayer temple for pregnancy and smooth delivery.
sen.cmt: the impregnation and safe delivery of a baby.→ pregnancy and smooth delivery

sen.j: この地蔵像は元禄期（1688年 - 1703年）に、文春諦玄という僧が、女性の安産を願って各地に勧進し造立したものである。
sen.e: This statue of Jizo was constructed by the monk Bunshun Teigen in all areas from 1688 to 1703 to promote the safe delivery of the babies fpr women.
This statue of Jizo was made at the solicitation of a priest called Bunshun Teigen from the people in various areas in the Genroku era (1688 to 1703) to promote the safe delivery of babies for women.
sen.cmt: 「文春諦玄の勧進により造られた」と訳すべきだと思ったので、修正を加えました。
sen.e: This statue of Jizo was made at the solicitation of a priest called Bunshun Teigen from the people in various areas in the Genroku era (1688 to 1703) to promote the safe delivery of babies for women.

sen.j: 明治の神仏分離令を前に慶応4年（1868年）に大神神社の神宮寺であった大御輪寺（だいごりんじ/おおみわでら）より十一面観音菩薩立像が移された。
sen.e: Before the the Edict of Separation of Shinto and Buddhism in Meiji period 1868, the standing statue of Juichimen Kannon Bosatsu (statue of Eleven faced Kannon Bosatsu) was transferred from Daigorin-ji Temple which was the Jingu-ji Temple (temples associated with shrines) of Omiwa-jinja shrine.

Before the Edict of Separation of Shinto and Buddhism in 1868 in the Meiji period, the standing statue of eleven-faced Kannon Bosatsu was transferred from Daigorin-ji Temple, which was a jingu-ji temple (a temple associated with a shrine) of Omiwa-jinja shrine, to Shorin-ji-Temple.
sen.cmt: “the”の重複あり、削除しました。十一面はeleven-facedで統一するべきと思います。神宮寺は固有名詞ではなく普通名詞だと思うので、小文字を使用しました。
sen.e: Before the Edict of Separation of Shinto and Buddhism in 1868 in the Meiji period, the standing statue of eleven-faced Kannon Bosatsu was transferred from Daigorin-ji Temple, which was a jingu-ji temple (a temple associated with a shrine) of Omiwa-jinja shrine, to Shorin-ji-Temple.

sen.j: 本堂－子安延命地蔵坐像を安置
sen.e: Hondo (main temple) - Seated statue of Koan Enmei Jizo is enshrined.
Hondo (main temple) — the seated statue of Koyasu Enmei Jizo is enshrined here.
Hondo (main temple) — the seated statue of Koyasu Enmei Jizo is enshrined here.

sen.j: 観音堂（大悲殿）－十一面観音立像を安置、元清水寺管長・大西良慶筆の扁額がかかる。
sen.e: Kannon-do Hall (a temple dedicated to Kannon) (Daihiden) - Standing statue of Juichimen Kannon is enshrined, and tablet written by Ryokei ONISHI, chief abbot of the post kiyomizu-dera temple is placed.

Kannon-do Hall (a temple dedicated to Kannon) (Daihiden) — the standing statue of eleven-faced Kannon is enshrined and a tablet written by Ryokei ONISHI, the former chief abbot of Kiyomizu-dera Temple, is placed.
sen.cmt: 「元」は清水寺ではなく官長にかかっていると思います。修正しました。
sen.e: Kannon-do Hall (a temple dedicated to Kannon) (Daihiden) — the standing statue of eleven-faced Kannon is enshrined and a tablet written by Ryokei ONISHI, the former chief abbot of Kiyomizu-dera Temple, is placed.

sen.j: 木心乾漆十一面観音立像（国宝）
sen.e: Standing statue of Mokushin Kanshitsu (wood-core dry lacquer) Eleven-faced Kannon (National treasure)
Standing statue of Mokushin Kanshitsu (wood-core dry lacquer) Eleven-faced Kannon (National treasure)
Standing statue of Mokushin Kanshitsu (wood-core dry lacquer) Eleven-faced Kannon (National treasure)

sen.j: 像高約209cm。
sen.e: Height of the statue is about 209cm.
It is about 209 cm in height.
It is about 209 cm in height.

sen.j: 木彫りで像の概形を作り、その上に木屑漆（こくそうるし、漆に木粉等を混ぜたもの）を盛り上げて造像する木心乾漆像で、奈良時代末期の作である。
sen.e: It is wooden statue of Mokushin Kanshitsu, made in the later years of Nara period which is made by carving the model, and putting kokuso-urusnhi (Japanese lacquer mixed with woodchip).

It is a statue made in the end of the Nara period, using a technique called Mokushin-kanshitsu, in which first the base shape is carved on wood and then the base is coated with kokuso-urusnhi (Japanese lacquer mixed with wood chips, etc.).
sen.cmt: 「木心乾漆」は技法の名前で人の名前ではないので、誤訳だと思います。直しました。
sen.e: It is a statue made in the end of the Nara period, using a technique called Mokushin-kanshitsu, in which first the base shape is carved on wood and then the base is coated with kokuso-urusnhi (Japanese lacquer mixed with wood chips, etc.).

sen.j: 前述のとおり、大神神社の神宮寺であった大御輪寺から移された客仏である。
sen.e: Like mentioned before, it is the Buddha transferred from Daigorin-ji Temple which was the Jingu-ji Temple of Omiwa-jinja shrine.
As mentioned above, it is the statue transferred from Daigorin-ji Temple, a jingu-ji temple of Omiwa-jinja Shrine.
sen.cmt: 表現を若干変更しました。
sen.e: As mentioned above, it is the statue transferred from Daigorin-ji Temple, a jingu-ji temple of Omiwa-jinja Shrine.

sen.j: 明治時代に来日した哲学者、美術研究家のアーネスト・フェノロサがこの像を激賞したことで知られるようになった。
sen.e: Ernest FENOLLOSA, philosopher and art researcher highly praised this statue when coming to Japan in Meiji period.
Ernest FENOLLOSA, a philosopher and art researcher, highly praised this statue when he came to Japan in the Meiji period.
sen.cmt: 冠詞、comma抜けあり、補足しました。
sen.e: Ernest FENOLLOSA, a philosopher and art researcher, highly praised this statue when he came to Japan in the Meiji period.

sen.j: 和辻哲郎も『古寺巡礼』（大正8年・1919年刊）でこの像を天平彫刻の最高傑作とほめたたえている。
sen.e: Tetsuro WATSUJI also praised this statue in 'Koji junrei' (A Pilgrimage to Ancient Temples) (published in 1919) as a masterpiece of Tempyo sculpture.
Tetsuro WATSUJI also praised this statue in "Koji Junrei (Pilgrimages to Ancient Temples)" (published in 1919) as the best work of the Tempyo sculptures (sculptures made around the Tempyo era).
sen.cmt: “”に変更し、「天平彫刻」の説明(sculptures made around the Tempyo era)を補足しました。
sen.e: Tetsuro WATSUJI also praised this statue in "Koji Junrei (Pilgrimages to Ancient Temples)" (published in 1919) as the best work of the Tempyo sculptures (sculptures made around the Tempyo era).

sen.j: ただし、この像については賛否両論があり、美術史家の町田甲一のように、この像は天平時代末期の形式化した作で、フェノロサや和辻の激賞したほどの傑作ではないとする意見もある。
sen.e: However, there are pros and cons regarding this statue, and there are other opinions like art historian, Koichi MACHIDA who said this statue is a typical art from the later years of Tempyo period, and it is not a masterpiece like FENOLLOSA and WATUJI said it was.

However, there are pros and cons on this statue; for instance, Koichi MACHIDA, an art historian, said that this statue is a conventional work of the end of the Tempyo period and not such a masterpiece as FENOLLOSA and WATSUJI extolled.
sen.cmt: 冠詞抜け、ローマ字表記ミス、他文法的に誤りありがあるため修正しました。単語も一部変更しました。
sen.e: However, there are pros and cons on this statue; for instance, Koichi MACHIDA, an art historian, said that this statue is a conventional work of the end of the Tempyo period and not such a masterpiece as FENOLLOSA and WATSUJI extolled.

sen.j: なお、本像の光背は断片化しているため、取り外して奈良国立博物館に寄託されている。
sen.e: The halo of this statue is fragmented, so it was taken apart and deposited to in the Nara National Museum.
The halo of this statue fragmented, so it was taken away and deposited in the Nara National Museum.
sen.cmt: Fragmentは自動詞なのでisを取りました。他前置詞も変えました。
sen.e: The halo of this statue fragmented, so it was taken away and deposited in the Nara National Museum.

sen.j: 石造地蔵菩薩坐像－聖林寺の本尊。
sen.e: Stone seated statue of Jizo Bosatsu - Honzo of Shorin-ji Temple.
Stone seated statue of Jizo Bosatsu — the honzo of Shorin-ji Temple.
Stone seated statue of Jizo Bosatsu — the honzo of Shorin-ji Temple.

sen.j: 江戸時代作の石造彩色像。
sen.e: Stone colored statue made in Edo period.
It is a colored stone statue made in the Edo period.
sen.cmt: 冠詞、形容詞の順を修正しました。It isを入れ文としました。
sen.e: It is a colored stone statue made in the Edo period.

sen.j: 子安延命地蔵と称され、子授けの地蔵として親しまれている。
sen.e: It was called Koan Enmei Jizo, and was known as the Jizo for hope to be blessed with children.
It is called Koyasu Enmei Jizo and known as a Jizo to pray for impregnation.
sen.cmt: 時制を直しました。「子安」は「koyasu」と読むのではと思います。
sen.e: It is called Koyasu Enmei Jizo and known as a Jizo to pray for impregnation.

sen.j: 西日本旅客鉄道桜井線・近鉄大阪線「桜井駅 (奈良県)」より奈良交通バス（多武峰、談山神社行）「聖林寺前」下車徒歩5分
sen.e: West Japan Railway Company Sakurai Line, Kintetsu Osaka Line 'Sakurai Station' (Nara Prefecture), then transfer to Nara Kotsu Bus (bound for Tanomine, Tanzan-jinja Shrine), and get off at 'Shorin-ji mae' and walk for 5 minutes.

Take a Nara Kotsu bus (bound for Tonomine, Tanzan-jinja Shrine) at 'Sakurai Station' (Nara Prefecture) on West Japan Railway Company Sakurai Line or Kintetsu Osaka Line, get off at 'Shorin-ji mae,' and walk for 5 minutes.
sen.cmt: ローマ字表記ミス、及び表現を修正しました。
sen.e: Take a Nara Kotsu bus (bound for Tonomine, Tanzan-jinja Shrine) at 'Sakurai Station' (Nara Prefecture) on West Japan Railway Company Sakurai Line or Kintetsu Osaka Line, get off at 'Shorin-ji mae,' and walk for 5 minutes.
9AM to 4:30 PM Entrance fee 400 yen.
Hours: 9AM to 4:30 PM, Entrance fee: 400 yen
Hours: 9AM to 4:30 PM, Entrance fee: 400 yen
